    This is the personal homepage of Elad Meidar, a web developer and an entrepreneur specializing in Ruby on Rails. I hang around Fort Lauderdale, FL and Tel-Aviv in Israel, and i am currently running Nautilus6 so Feel free to contact me regarding projects :).

GET

Bag O' Links - 24/5/2010

Phew! it was a long time since i last posted Bago’. Israel keeps me busy.

  • Dive into HTML5 – HTML5 guide. looks ok.
  • Very simple parallelization with Ruby – not the best implementation i’ve seen, but will work on small scale solutions.
  • Ruby’s #inject- i have been using ruby and rails for more than 4 years, and i got how to use #inject only yesterday.
  • Ruby’s TempFile explained – Avdi’s share on Tempfile.
  • OrientDB – Another NoSQL implementation. supposed to be really fast.
  • Rails 2.3.6 changeset – probably my last version.
  • Ruby VM shootout – interesting.
  • Upgrading Rails 2 to Rails 3 – wuhoo.
  • Ruby Proxy Pattern and Dynamic Delegation with ActiveSupport BasicObject – implementation and an excellent walkthrough.
  • Ruby’s equality operands – a good read.
  • Write-Through Cacheing is an Essential Part of a Healthy Scaling Strategy – great scaling read.
  • List of generators for Designers – some are nice.
  • Testing Javascript with cucumber – ha! nice.
  • MongoDB master-slave installation – howto.
  • Feature flipper for Rails – deploy specific features, awesome.

Treasures

  • jsChat – a nice chat engine using javascript and MongoDB.
  • Google Fonts API – nice, font-face will get a boost from this one. (here are the fonts)
  • fancy-buttons – Easily style buttons with beautiful CSS3 features like gradients, rounded corners, etc. Don’t worry the buttons also degrade nicely for browsers with no support. requires Compass though, which is annoying.
  • ZeroMQ – java based MQ manager. looks great.
  • ShowOff – presentations made simple. wicked.
  • Google’s S3? – Storage for developers.
  • to_xls – convert objects to excel spreadsheets.
  • KingSOA – KingSoa orchestrates a SOA landscape, by knowing where services live and how to call them.
  • Linkscape – a library to access SEOmoz’s API.
  • ActiveCart – a basic shopping cart implementation.
  • MongoHub – native MacOS MongoDB GUI.
